21ce68e93a44899e990ec0b667ae2706.title: Should the Timberwolves Really Trade for Jimmy Butler?

e634b98929bc9d8561b5b1fb5b2d7c0e.title: Should the Timberwolves Really Trade for Jimmy Butler?

paragraphs.name: 40d8
paragraphs.text: Chicago, meanwhile, could sell high on Jimmy Butler in exchange for youth and picks, both of which are crucial to any rebuild. Although a full-fledged rebuild may be tough for the Bulls to accept, the franchise probably needs to move on from the turbulent Rose-Butler administration, lest it remain mired in mediocrity. The no. 5 pick represents a tantalizing opportunity to add a blue-chip college prospect like Cal’s Jaylen Brown or Oklahoma’s Buddy Hield.

40cf4cc48865.title: What about the point that the Bulls head office hate Thibs!

paragraphs.name: 2b7f
paragraphs.text: What about the point that the Bulls head office hate Thibs! hence this will never happen just to spite him. Pointless article.

1ddc59b4175d.title: If I’m Thibs/ the Wolves, I let this monster they have brewing grow up on its own.

paragraphs.name: 77d3
paragraphs.text: If I’m Thibs/ the Wolves, I let this monster they have brewing grow up on its own. Everyone has started to take notice, the Wolves’ future behemoth is being mentioned as a looming threat. Don’t trade the proverbial Harden, let the team develop and grow up naturally.

d882720ed35a.title: What about the supposed chemistry issues between Hoiberg &Butler?

paragraphs.name: 64fd
paragraphs.text: What about the supposed chemistry issues between Hoiberg &Butler? The Bulls would be unlikely to do any trading that might help out Thibodeau either.

59e28a6a99f6.title: They would literally be insane NOT to trade for Jimmy Butler. That guy has no ceiling. None.

paragraphs.name: 4c3a
paragraphs.text: They would literally be insane NOT to trade for Jimmy Butler. That guy has no ceiling. None.

daac4de20e02.title: Lavine is 21 years old and put up 18 ppg and 43% from 3pt after he repeated as dunk champion and…

paragraphs.name: fa35
paragraphs.text: Lavine is 21 years old and put up 18 ppg and 43% from 3pt after he repeated as dunk champion and got put into the starting lineup. Wiggins is 21 and put up 20.7 ppg 46%FG….Butler put up 20.9 ppg 45% shooting….So why exactly would the Wolves want to trade Lavine OR Wiggins for this guy? They are young and still on rookie contracts. I would give up the…

virtuals.subtitle: Thibs is tempted to go after his former swingman, but it may be the wrong move

paragraphs.name: ff4c
paragraphs.text: Should the Timberwolves Really Trade for Jimmy Butler?

fb9c3b64b383.title: Trading LaVine and #5 also means the Wolves have no real 3pt threat anymore.

paragraphs.name: b403
paragraphs.text: Trading LaVine and #5 also means the Wolves have no real 3pt threat anymore. Butler, Wiggins, and Rubio are all below average at best, Towns shouldn’t be shooting them regularly (even though he loves to step out there a few times a game), and Bjelica still needs to show he can keep up.

a31376c1c5ec.title: Do not understand the infatuation with Buddy.

paragraphs.name: b201
paragraphs.text: Do not understand the infatuation with Buddy.

fea670531f17.title: Butler is only 26, it’s not like he’s THAT much older than KAT and Wiggins.

paragraphs.name: 5bd1
paragraphs.text: Butler is only 26, it’s not like he’s THAT much older than KAT and Wiggins. And it’s not like this would be another Kevin Love/Klay Thompson or Kevin Love/Andrew Wiggins scenario, unless you think Levine will be a superstar (he certainly has the raw skills).

5a7a77b62db8.title: This article is a pie in the sky hypothetical that has no chance of materializing.

paragraphs.name: 9f5e
paragraphs.text: This article is a pie in the sky hypothetical that has no chance of materializing.

59dedc077e37.title: If they can keep Wiggins and LaVine, do it.

paragraphs.name: 0a69
paragraphs.text: If they can keep Wiggins and LaVine, do it. If not, pass. Butler would be an awesome fit with KAT and AW. I would like to see them in the playoffs next year and that trade would almost guarantee a playoff birth.

283f3f07c71.title: Wiggins production is way overrated and LaVine isn’t that far behind him but he will be way cheaper…

paragraphs.name: d63d
paragraphs.text: Wiggins production is way overrated and LaVine isn’t that far behind him but he will be way cheaper in the long run. Dieng is also underrated and much of the Wolves late season improvement last year happened when Dieng was put into the starting lineup WITH Karl-Anthony Towns. Keep Lavine and Dieng, sell high on Wiggins.

55c1fe3c84a3.title: Don’t Jimmy Buckets and Wiggins play the same position and do essentially the same things?

paragraphs.name: f8b5
paragraphs.text: Don’t Jimmy Buckets and Wiggins play the same position and do essentially the same things?

paragraphs.name: e745
paragraphs.text: Probably?! Firing Thibs was horrible and they just keep making bad decision after bad decision. Yes, we must move on from this era, definitely without Rose but only probably without Butler.
